Carina Nebula.Notes: The Carina Nebula (a.k.a., Eta Carinae Nebula) is a large bright nebula that surrounds several open clusters of stars. It is ~4x larger than the Orion Nebula.
captions:
Long exposure photograph of the Carina Nebula along with NGC 3324, taken from the Kalahari Desert in Namibia. North is up.
Total exposure time was four hours; 24 frames at 10 minutes each with six frames each for luminosity, red, green and blue. Telescope was an Officina Stellare Riccardi-Honders Veloce RH 200 OTA, camera was an SBIG STL-11000M on an AP GTO1200 mount, guided with PHD.
Eta Carinae, surrounded by the Homunculus Nebula
Eta Carinae observed in different wavelengths

Annotated map of part of the Carina Nebula showing the location of various objects in the nebula. This view combines multiple ground and Hubble observatory images in a <template><title>convert</title><part><name index="1"/><value>50</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>ly</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>pc</value></part><part><name>adj</name><equals>=</equals><value>mid</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>wide</value></part></template> view.
